WSGI Configuration¶

app_cfg¶

Global configuration file for TG2-specific settings in SPAM.

This file complements development/deployment.ini.

Please note that all the argument values are strings. If you want to convert them into boolean, for example, you should use the paste.deploy.converters.asbool() function, as in:

from paste.deploy.converters import asbool
setting = asbool(global_conf.get('the_setting'))

environment¶

WSGI environment setup for SPAM.

spam.config.environment.load_environment(global_conf, app_conf)¶

Configure the Pylons environment via pylons.configuration.config.

middleware¶

WSGI middleware initialization for the SPAM application.

spam.config.middleware.make_app(global_conf, full_stack=True, **app_conf)¶

Set SPAM up with the settings found in the PasteDeploy configuration file used.

Parameters:
  • global_conf (dict) – The global settings for spam (those defined under the [DEFAULT] section).
  • full_stack (str or bool) – Should the whole TG2 stack be set up?
Returns:

The spam application with all the relevant middleware loaded.

This is the PasteDeploy factory for the spam application.

app_conf contains all the application-specific settings (those defined under [app:main].
